div.a: Updates from ReNEW Schools on Coronavirus Impacts
Updates from NOLA Public Schools on Coronavirus Impacts
Updates from ReNEW Schools on Coronavirus Impacts
Updates from NOLA Public Schools on Coronavirus Impacts

article.class: entry h-entry hentry author-scott-satchfield post-type-text article-index-1

div.p: Wednesday, Governor John Bel Edwards ordered school facilities to remain closed through the end of the academic year.

The school building will remain closed, but there is work still to be done relating to this academic year. We have more than a month of school remaining and we will continue the plan set forth last month, through the remainder of this school year.

For our elementary students, please check our website, renewschools.org, for assignments that began this week and that document is updated through the remainder of the year. We are working through the end-of-year logistics and will inform you of important dates to check in materials and to retrieve any belongings that remain at school. Expect to receive this information within the next couple of weeks.
For our students at RAHS, please continue with your coursework to ensure you are proficient in the course prior to the close of the school year.

Parents and guardians, please continue to ensure students complete their assignments at home and reach out to your point person, advisor, or teacher with any question or concerns you may have along the way. I hope that you and your family are safe during this time and please let us know if there is any other way that we can assist you and your family.
Miercoles, el gobernador John Bel Edwards ordenó que las instalaciones de las escuelas permanezcan cerradas hasta fin de año.
Nos queda más de un mes de escuela y continuaremos con el plan establecido el mes pasado, durante el resto del año escolar.

Para nuestros estudiantes de primaria, consulte nuestro sitio web, renewschools.org, para ver las tareas que comienzan esta semana, ese documento se actualizará durante el resto del año escolar. Estamos trabajando en la logística y le informaremos las fechas en la segunda mitad del mes de mayo para devolver las tareas y materiales completados a la escuela.
Para nuestros estudiantes en RAHS, continúe con su trabajo de curso para asegurarse de que sea competente en la clase antes del cierre del año escolar.

Padres y tutores, continúen asegurándose de que los estudiantes completen sus tareas en casa y se comuniquen con su persona de contacto, asesor o maestro con cualquier pregunta o inquietud que puedan tener en el camino. Espero que usted y su familia estén seguros durante este tiempo y háganos saber si hay alguna otra manera en que podamos ayudarlo a usted y a su familia.

article.class: entry h-entry hentry author-scott-satchfield post-type-text article-index-2

h1.a: NOLA-PS Announces Districtwide School Closures Extension Through April 30

div.p: April 2, 2020 -- (News Release from NOLA Public Schools) Per today’s announcement by Governor John Bel Edwards to extend the stay-at-home order through April 30th, all NOLA public schools will remain closed for the duration of the month of April. This necessary action is an effective way to slow the spread of COVID-19 across our city and state.

span.data-title: NOLA-PS Announces Districtwide School Closures Extension Through April 30

article.class: entry h-entry hentry author-scott-satchfield post-type-text article-index-3

h1.a: (Tuesday 3/17) ReNEW SciTech added to citywide nutrition program starting Wednesday (See full list)

div.p: March 17, 2020 - ReNEW SciTech Academy (820 Jackson Avenue) will begin serving free ‘grab & go’ breakfast and lunch on Wednesday, March 18 from 9 AM - 12 PM.

span.data-title: (Tuesday 3/17) ReNEW SciTech added to citywide nutrition program starting Wednesday (See full list)

article.class: entry h-entry hentry author-scott-satchfield post-type-text article-index-4

div.p: March 15, 2020 - Limited-income households can apply with several service providers reduced-price internet access.

article.class: entry h-entry hentry author-scott-satchfield post-type-text article-index-5

div.p: This message contains important updates for you and your students.

Yesterday we learned that all ReNEW schools, along with all other NOLA public schools are required to close beginning Monday, March 16. We will provide updates on our website, renewschools.org, via phone, and on our Instagram and Facebook social media accounts. If you haven’t already, please “like” or “follow” your school’s social media page to keep up with new information and refer back to it as we have updates to share with you.

article.class: entry h-entry hentry author-scott-satchfield post-type-text article-index-6

h1.a: (Friday 3/13) Letter to ReNEW families on school closures

div.p: ReNEW Schools has been closely monitoring all developments related to the coronavirus (COVID-19) and its impact on our community. We are committed to taking all the necessary precautions to prevent the spread of COVID-19 and to protect the well-being of our students, teachers, and staff.

span.data-title: (Friday 3/13) Letter to ReNEW families on school closures
